ETCOP_TOOL.NAME: Pdf To Images Tool
ETCOP_TOOL.DESCRIPTION: Converts a PDF file into an array of images, each representing a page of the PDF.

ETCOP_TOOL.NAME: Etendo SQL to CSV Downloader Tool
ETCOP_TOOL.DESCRIPTION: Tool to execute SQL queries in Etendo using the DBQueryExec webhook and convert results to CSV. This tool connects to Etendo's database through the DBQueryExec webhook, executes SELECT queries, and downloads the JSON result converted to CSV format. REQUIREMENTS: Only SELECT queries are allowed, all tables must have aliases (e.g., 'SELECT u.name FROM ad_user u'), and tables must be accessible to the current user. Security filters are automatically applied by Etendo. Authentication and Etendo host are handled automatically through the copilot context. Parameters: sql_query (required), output_file (optional), include_headers (optional, default: true).

ETCOP_TOOL.NAME: File Downloader Tool
ETCOP_TOOL.DESCRIPTION: This tool receives a URL , downloads the file to a temporary directory if its a URL in a temp file. It returns the path to the temporary file.

ETCOP_TOOL.NAME: XLS/CSV Reader Tool
ETCOP_TOOL.DESCRIPTION: A tool to read an XLS/CSV file and retrieve its content.

ETCOP_TOOL.NAME: Tavily Search Tool
ETCOP_TOOL.DESCRIPTION: Tool to perform searches in Tavily. Tavily is a search engine that allows you to search the internet for information. This tool will return the search results for the given query

ETCOP_TOOL.NAME: File Copy Tool
ETCOP_TOOL.DESCRIPTION: This tool receives two paths, one of a file and another of a directory, copies the file to the directory. Returns the path of the copied file. Example of input: { "source_path": "/home/user/file.txt", "destination_directory": "/home/user/destination_directory" }

ETCOP_TOOL.NAME: GoogleSpreadsheetsTool
ETCOP_TOOL.DESCRIPTION: Tool to interact with Google Spreadsheets through Google Drive API. The tool have the following modes: - list: List all accessible spreadsheets. - create: Create a new spreadsheet with the specified name. Optionally add headers as the first row. - upload: Upload a csv file to Google Drive as a new spreadsheet. - read: Read the content of a specified spreadsheet. - download: Download a specified spreadsheet as a CSV file.

ETCOP_TOOL.NAME: Send Email Tool
ETCOP_TOOL.DESCRIPTION: This tool sends an email using the SMTP method or the Resend method. It is very important not to omit information, because the email is sent to another person and the information must be clear and concise, and not summarized.

ETCOP_TOOL.NAME: Audio Recognition Tool
ETCOP_TOOL.DESCRIPTION: This is a tool that uses OpenAI's API to transcribe audio files.

ETCOP_TOOL.NAME: Codbar Tool
ETCOP_TOOL.DESCRIPTION: This tool reads a barcode from an image. Receives "filepath" as an array string parameter. The "filepath" parameter are the paths of the image files to read. The tool will return an array of founded barcodes if found. Example of input: { "filepath": ["/tmp/test.png"] }

ETCOP_TOOL.NAME: GoogleDriveTool
ETCOP_TOOL.DESCRIPTION: Tool to interact with Google Drive. Supports: - 'list': list accessible files of a certain type. - 'upload': upload a local file to Drive.

ETCOP_TOOL.NAME: Uncompress tool
ETCOP_TOOL.DESCRIPTION: This tool uncompresses a file and returns the path list of the uncompressed files.It receives a path to a compressed file and uncompresses it.

ETCOP_TOOL.NAME: LoadOAuthTokenTool
ETCOP_TOOL.DESCRIPTION: This tool loads an OAuth token and returns a message indicating the alias wich was used to load the token.

ETCOP_TOOL.NAME: Docker Tool
ETCOP_TOOL.DESCRIPTION: A tool that manages Docker containers to run Python or Bash code. Containers are deleted when specified after 1 hour of inactivity.

ETCOP_TOOL.NAME: Print Directory Tool
ETCOP_TOOL.DESCRIPTION: This tool prints the files and directories of the a directory.

ETCOP_TOOL.NAME: Write File Tool
ETCOP_TOOL.DESCRIPTION: This is a tool for writing files. Receives: "filepath": string, "content": string, "lineno": integer.The "filepath" parameter is the path of the file to write.The "content" parameter is the content of the file to write.The "override" parameter is a boolean that indicates if the tool needs to override the file or not. The "lineno" parameter is the line number where to write the content. If the line number is not specified, the content will be appended to the end of the file.The tool will return the content of the file. Example of input: { "filepath": "/tmp/test.txt", "content": "Hello world", "override": true, "lineno": 1 }

ETCOP_TOOL.NAME: Read File Tool
ETCOP_TOOL.DESCRIPTION: This is a tool for reading files. Receives "filepath" string parameter. The "filepath" parameter is the path of the file to read. The tool will return the content of the file.Example of input: { "filepath": "/tmp/test.txt" }

ETCOP_TOOL.NAME: Template Tool
ETCOP_TOOL.DESCRIPTION: This is a file template for creating new tools.

ETCOP_TOOL.NAME: Attach File Tool
ETCOP_TOOL.DESCRIPTION: Uploads a file to an API after checking its existence and accessibility.

ETCOP_TOOL.NAME: Memory Tool
ETCOP_TOOL.DESCRIPTION: A comprehensive tool for managing user memories in a vector database. Supports four operation modes: 'add' (requires 'memory' field), 'search' (requires 'query' field, optional 'k' for result limit), 'update' (requires 'memory_id' and 'memory' fields), 'delete' (requires 'memory_id' field). All operations are user-scoped and use memory_id for specific memory identification.

ETCOP_TOOL.NAME: Task Creator Tool
ETCOP_TOOL.DESCRIPTION: Processes a ZIP, CSV, or Excel file and creates a task for each extracted file or row. For ZIP files, each uncompressed file's full path is added to the question/request. For CSV or Excel files, the header row is skipped and each subsequent row task includes the header and the row data. If the file format is unsupported, a task is created with the file path.

ETCOP_TOOL.NAME: OpenAPI Tool for PetStore API
ETCOP_TOOL.DESCRIPTION: This tools interacts with a PetStore API answer/execute the question prompt.If a Bearer token is provided, it will be used as the authentication header. It may be necessary to run the tool once without a token to obtain it and then run it again with the token obtained.

ETCOP_TOOL.NAME: OCR Tool
ETCOP_TOOL.DESCRIPTION: This is a OCR tool implementation that returns an appropriate JSON object for the data in a local file (image or pdf). Its important to note that the file should be in the local file system. Is the best way to extract the data/information from a image or pdf file.

ETCOP_TOOL.NAME: API Call tool
ETCOP_TOOL.DESCRIPTION: This Tool, executes a call to an API, and returns the response. This tool requires the following parameters: - url: The url of the API (for example: https://api.example.com) (required) - endpoint: The endpoint of the API (for example: /endpoint) (required) - method: The method of the API (GET, POST and PUT only supported). If not defined, it will be inferred from the endpoint. (for example: GET) (required) - body_params: The body of the API (only for POST method) - query_params: The query params of the API in json format - token: The bearer token of the API (if required)
